NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. to a large extent, or in a large amount 广泛地;大量地
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She has read extensively.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 智力  intelligent a. 聪明的，有才智的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Use your intelligence! (= Don't be so foolish.)

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 争论;争议
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The lie detector（测谎仪）tests have been the subject of much controversy.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. be or go all around (sth. or sb.) 围绕;包围
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She was sitting on the floor surrounded by books.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 意识
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. David lost consciousness at eight o'clock and died a few hours later.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. examine thoroughly, learn about 探究，探索
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We must explore all the possibilities.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. easy to see and understand; clear 明显的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I've got my exams tomorrow, so for obvious reasons I won't be able to come out tonight.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 兽医
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I took my dog to the vet/to the vet's.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. meet, esp. unexpectedly 遇到,遭遇
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We encountered a lot of problems/opposition（反对）.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. make (sth.) known 展示;揭露
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He revealed his secrets to his friends.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. make ( sb.) feel sure by the use of argument or evidence 使确信,使信服
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We finally convinced them of our innocence（清白）.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 技艺;业绩，功绩
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. A racing car is an extraordinary feat of engineering.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 被俘;监禁;束缚
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The hostages（人质）were released from captivity.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. ruling; most important or strongest 统治的;占优势的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Blue is the dominant color in his later paintings.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. (单复同)物种
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. There are several species of zebra（斑马）.

NewWords.WordPhrase: reach an agreement or arrangement, esp. in business or politics 达成交易
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The company has made a deal with a Japanese firm to supply engines.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 自然资源保护论者
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The plans to build a big road through the forest were cancelled due to pressure from conservationists.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. 雌的;女(性)的  n. 雌性的动物或植物;女人
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The females are often more aggressive than the males.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 大猩猩
a. causing or showing a feeling that sth. is wrong 可疑的;猜疑的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. If you see anything suspicious, inform the police at once.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 花生
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She always eats peanuts when watching TV.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. without expression; without writing, or other marks 没有表情的;空白的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. If you press this key the screen will go blank.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. discuss in order to come to an agreement 谈判,协商
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We are negotiating (with the council) to have this road closed to traffic.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. (usu.pl) 奖品;奖金;赌注
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The game was usually played for high stakes between two large groups.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 凤梨,菠萝
vt. continue to do or have (sth.) 保持;继续
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He took the lead, and maintained it until the end of the race.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. free (sb.) from pain, anxiety, etc.; ease (pain, anxiety, etc.) 使减轻痛苦或焦虑等;减轻(痛苦或焦虑等)
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Let me relieve you of that heavy parcel/of some of the housework.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 链环;环节;联系  v. join or connect 联系，连接
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Research has established a link between smoking and lung cancer.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 猩猩
vt. (undertook, undertaken) carry out; take upon oneself (a task,etc.) 从事;承担(任务等)
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He undertook to pay the money back within six months.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  人类学者
understand; reason out 理解;推断出
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I can't figure him out -- he's a mystery!

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. (cause to) stretch or reach; make larger or longer 延伸,伸展;扩大;加长
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The hot weather extended into October.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. (usu.pl) business relations 交易，买卖
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Our company is proud of its reputation for fair dealing.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. 塑料的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. a black plastic bag

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 薄片;碎片;集成电路片
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. memory chips for computers

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. (cause to) grow larger 扩大，扩展
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The company has expanded its operating in Scotland by building a new factory there.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. change; shift 转换，变换
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The wind has switched round from north to east.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 金属薄片,箔
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Wrap the chicken in foil before you cook it.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. showing moral goodness 有道德的;善良的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. an intelligent, courageous and virtuous family man

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt., n. 妒忌;羡慕
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I envy your ability to work so fast.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 葡萄
ad. immediately 立即地
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The performance will begin promptly at nine o'clock.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 茎,(树)干,(叶)梗
n. 鲸
vi. act or work together 合作，协作
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The British cooperated with the French in designing the satellite.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 行为主义者
to sb.'s advantage 为了某人的利益
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He gave up his share in the interests of fairness.

NewWords.WordPhrase: help very much; achieve much success 帮助很大;很有成效
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Your suggestion will go far towards solving our present housing problem.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 顾问
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He was a consultant to a software firm.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. the way one acts or behaves 举止，行为
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Her good behavior deserves praise.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. judge the quality, importance or worth of 评估，估量
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He is so lazy that it's difficult to assess his ability.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 判断;意见，看法
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. In my judgment, we should accept the employer's offer.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 配偶;伙伴,同事
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He's off drinking with his mates.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. (thrived or throve, thrived) grow strong and healthy; develop well 茁壮成长;兴旺
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Few plants or animals thrive in the desert.

NewWords.WordPhrase: at the beginning 起先
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. At first I didn't like him but now I do.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 担架
n. an unexpected and dangerous happening which must be dealt with at once 紧急情况;突然事件
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Ring the bell in an emergency.

NewWords.WordPhrase: stop developing well 有毛病，出故障
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The sum hasn't work out, but I can't see where I went wrong.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. (cause to) stop 停住,停止
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The train was halted by work on the line.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (infml) vomit 呕吐
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She said she had thrown up after reading the reports of trial.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. it is clear (that) 明显地
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Apparently she never got my letter after all.

NewWords.WordPhrase: carefully examine (a situation or person) in order to make a judgement 估量，判断
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He sized the situation up at a glance and took immediate action.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. set free 释放
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She released the rabbit from the trap.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v.  (slid) (cause to) move smoothly along a surface (使)滑动
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She slid along the ice.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 灵长目动物
n. sth. that gives a reason for believing sth.; trace 证据;迹象
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. When the police arrived, he had already destroyed the evidence of his guilt.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. try to make(sb.) believe sth. that is false 欺骗
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Unless my eyes deceive me, that's the vice-president sitting over there.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. very difficult or impossible to reach 达不到的;难得到的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This novel seems to me among the most inaccessible.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. first or earliest 最初的;原始的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The original owner of the house was a Frenchman.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. (生长在同一地方的动物或植物)群，群体;殖民地
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. a former French colony in Africa

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 雄性动物或植物;男子  a. 雄的;男(性)的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. In most birds the male is bigger and more brightly colored than the female.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.,v. 凝视，注视
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She turned her worried gaze from one person to the other.

NewWords.WordPhrase: 让步;屈服;投降
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Don't give in to their demands.

NewWords.WordPhrase: prep.,ad. under or below 在...下面，在...底下
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The letter was pushed underneath the door.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. 笨的
n. (海)龟
v. remain alive in spite of; continue to live or exist after 幸免于;继续存在，幸存  survival n.
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He survived in the desert for a week on biscuits and water.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. an event causing great suffering and damage 灾难
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The flood was a terrible disaster; hundreds of people died.

NewWords.WordPhrase: get rid of or destroy 消灭，消除
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The entire population was wiped out by the terrible disease.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 恐龙
n. 眼界,见识;地平线
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This series of talks is intended to broaden our horizons.
